result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Clifton V Hazwood Jr

records.addlTxt:
10:52 AM Defendant Clifton V Hazwood Jr in court. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Niki Kane. The defendant is asking for additional time to seek counsel. No objection by the State. The Court will set this matter back for status of counsel. Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.
Hearing scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Cash bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of $1000.00

10:12 AM Defendant Clifton V Hazwood Jr not in court. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Niki Kane. State motions the Court to issue a warrant for the defendant and to revoke and forfeit any bail.

ADDRESS INFO for Clifton V Hazwood Jr
Current: c/o Waukesha County Jail, 515 W. Moreland Boulevard, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States  (Effective: 10-14-2022)
Prior: 3325A N 26th St, Milwaukee, WI 53206

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed. Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia. Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms.

2:58 PM Defendant Clifton V Hazwood Jr in court, in custody.  Attorney Ricardo Tapia, as a friend of the court, in court for Clifton V Hazwood Jr. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Julian Marruto.
Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation. Court advises of right to an attorney. Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing. Defendant given the petition for the appointment of counsel.
Hearing scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Waukesha County Public Safety Assessment Report filed by Wisconsin Community Services.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
